quote: Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom.
author: Aristotle

quote: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
author: Socrates

quote: Be kind, for everyone you meet is fighting a hard battle.
author: Plato

quote: Nature does nothing in vain.
author: Aristotle

quote: Wonder is the beginning of wisdom.
author: Socrates

quote: To find yourself, think for yourself.
author: Socrates

quote: Pleasure in the job puts perfection in the work.
author: Aristotle

quote: Wise men speak because they have something to say; fools because they have to say something.
author: Plato

quote: He who has overcome his fears will truly be free.
author: Aristotle

quote: At the touch of love everyone becomes a poet.
author: Plato

quote: Time is a created thing. To say 'I don't have time,' is like saying, 'I don't want to.'
author: Laozi

quote: Mastering others is strength; mastering yourself is true power.
author: Laozi

quote: Act without expectation.
author: Laozi

quote: Care about what other people think and you will always be their prisoner.
author: Laozi

quote: Respond intelligently even to unintelligent treatment.
author: Laozi

quote: Knowledge is a treasure, but practice is the key to it.
author: Laozi

quote: To see things in the seed, that is genius.
author: Laozi

quote: Great acts are made up of small deeds.
author: Laozi

quote: An ant on the move does more than a dozing ox.
author: Laozi

quote: Do not impose on others what you yourself do not desire.
author: Confucius

quote: Real knowledge is to know the extent of one's ignorance.
author: Confucius

quote: The man who moves a mountain begins by carrying away small stones.
author: Confucius

quote: Our greatest glory is not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
author: Confucius

quote: Study the past if you would define the future.
author: Confucius

quote: When we see men of a contrary character, we should turn inwards and examine ourselves.
author: Confucius

quote: The superior man is modest in his speech but exceeds in his actions.
author: Confucius

quote: Virtue is not left to stand alone. He who practices it will have neighbors.
author: Confucius

quote: By nature, men are nearly alike; by practice, they get to be wide apart.
author: Confucius

quote: The cautious seldom err.
author: Confucius

quote: Silence is a true friend who never betrays.
author: Confucius

quote: Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated.
author: Confucius

quote: To see what is right and not do it is the want of courage.
author: Confucius

quote: All men's souls are immortal, but the souls of the righteous are immortal and divine.
author: Socrates

quote: Beware the barrenness of a busy life.
author: Socrates

quote: Contentment is natural wealth, luxury is artificial poverty.
author: Socrates

quote: Death may be the greatest of all human blessings.
author: Socrates

quote: Employ your time in improving yourself by other men's writings so that you shall come easily by what others have labored hard for.
author: Socrates

quote: He is richest who is content with the least, for content is the wealth of nature.
author: Socrates

quote: I know that I am intelligent because I know that I know nothing.
author: Socrates

quote: If a man is proud of his wealth, he should not be praised until it is known how he employs it.
author: Socrates

quote: It is not living that matters, but living rightly.
author: Socrates

quote: Let him that would move the world first move himself.
author: Socrates

quote: Not life, but good life, is to be chiefly valued.
author: Socrates

quote: The unexamined life is not worth living.
author: Socrates

quote: Thou shouldst eat to live; not live to eat.
author: Socrates

quote: True knowledge exists in knowing that you know nothing.
author: Socrates

quote: True wisdom comes to each of us when we realize how little we understand about life, ourselves, and the world around us.
author: Socrates

quote: We cannot live better than in seeking to become better.
author: Socrates

quote: Where there is reverence, there is fear, but there is not reverence everywhere that there is fear because fear presumably has a wider extension than reverence.
author: Socrates

quote: Wisdom begins in wonder.
author: Socrates

quote: Wonder is the beginning of wisdom.
author: Socrates

quote: To be is to do.
author: Socrates

quote: To do is to be.
author: Socrates

quote: Do be do be do.
author: Socrates

quote: Be as you wish to seem.
author: Socrates

quote: Envy is the ulcer of the soul.
author: Socrates

quote: He who is not contented with what he has would not be contented with what he would like to have.
author: Socrates

quote: I am not an Athenian or a Greek, but a citizen of the world.
author: Socrates

quote: One thing I know, that I know nothing. This is the source of my wisdom.
author: Socrates

quote: The only good is knowledge and the only evil is ignorance.
author: Socrates

quote: Those who are hardest to love need it the most.
author: Socrates

quote: To find yourself, think for yourself.
author: Socrates

quote: Understanding a question is half an answer.
author: Socrates

quote: Education is the kindling of a flame, not the filling of a vessel.
author: Socrates

quote: Sometimes you put walls up not to keep people out, but to see who cares enough to break them down.
author: Socrates

quote: Know thyself.
author: Socrates

quote: Be slow to fall into friendship; but when thou art in, continue firm and constant.
author: Socrates

quote: Bad men live that they may eat and drink, whereas good men eat and drink that they may live.
author: Socrates

quote: Remember that there is nothing stable in human affairs; therefore avoid undue elation in prosperity, or undue depression in adversity.
author: Socrates

quote: All I know is that I know nothing.
author: Socrates

quote: An honest man is always a child.
author: Socrates

quote: Beauty is a short-lived tyranny.
author: Socrates

quote: Be of good cheer about death and know this truth: that no evil can happen to a good man, either in life or after death.
author: Socrates

quote: False words are not only evil in themselves, but they infect the soul with evil.
author: Socrates

quote: Give me beauty in the inward soul; may the outward and the inward man be at one.
author: Socrates
